repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Fiscal Reform Support
            Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment demonstrates the
            outstanding project performance: highly satisfactory
            outcome, highly likely sustainability, substantial
            institutional development impacts, enhanced by highly
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank, and Borrower.
            Lessons from similar operations in the region, stress the
            importance of sustained Government ownership of reforms, and
            strong constituent support; adequate institutional capacity
            to implement the reforms, and monitor progress and outcomes;
            effective monitoring of the economic, and social impact of
            reforms, particularly on the most vulnerable members of
            society. These lessons were incorporated in the
            implementation, and monitoring arrangements for the Fiscal
            Reform Support Project, by matching the level of Government
            commitment, and implementation capacity to the pace of
            program execution, and, by proceeding to program
            implementation, with clearly defined development objectives,
            and an effective monitoring system.

5084779.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Fiscal Reforms Support
            Operations Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Within the strategic context set forth
            in 1997, the Fiscal Reform Support Operation Project, will
            help ensure implementation of sound macroeconomic policies,
            and achieve strong sectoral reforms, to create an
            environment conducive to private sector-led economic growth
            in Mauritania. This project is a one tranche operation,
            designed to harmonize the corporate, and personal tax regime
            with its neighbor countries, particularly, the Arab
            Maghrebian Union, and with Mali, and Senegal, its partners
            under the Organisation de la Mise en Valeur du Fleuve
            Senegal (OMVS). The operation aims at aligning its external
            tariffs with neighboring countries, while continuing to
            implement macroeconomic policies, though structural reforms,
            and a poverty reduction strategy. Furthermore, the project
            will facilitate the country's economic integration,
            both regionally, and globally. Over the medium- and
            long-term, the direct tax reform, and tariff alignment,
            should assist Mauritania's growth, through the
            improvement of resource mobilization, and private investment
            flows, as well as through economic diversification, and
            external trade. Education, health, and poverty reduction
            programs will be enhanced through efficient public
            expenditure allocations, with significant impacts on poverty
            reduction. Risks are mitigated by the fact that the
            government has already taken actions on the divestiture
            program, and on a number of reforms.
